sen.j: 藤原 師高（ふじわら の もろたか、生年不詳 - 安元3年6月9日 (旧暦)（1177年7月6日））は日本の平安時代後期の受領。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Morotaka (year of birth unknown - July 6, 1177) was a zuryo (custodial governor) who lived in the late Heian period.

sen.j: 父は後白河天皇の権臣であった西光（俗名：藤原師光）。
sen.e: Morotaka's father was known as Saiko (secular name: FUJIWARA no Moromitsu), who was an Emperor Goshirakawa's influential vassal.

sen.j: 伯父に藤原成親、弟に藤原師経・藤原師平がいる。
sen.e: Morotaka had an uncle named FUJIWARA no Narichika, and younger brothers named FUJIWARA no Morotsune and FUJIWARA no Morohira.

sen.j: 検非違使五位尉から、父の引き立てで安元元年（1175年）12月29日 (旧暦)、加賀国国司となり、弟の藤原師経を目代として遙任する。
sen.e: Starting with Kebiishi no jo (second officer of the imperial police bureau) of Fifth Rank, Morotaka was his father's patronage appointee to the post of a Kokushi (provincial governor) of Kaga Province who was remotely appointed, having his younger brother FUJIWARA no Morotsune as his mokudai (deputy kokushi, or a deputy provincial governor).

sen.j: 安元3年（1177年）、延暦寺の末寺白山涌泉寺と紛争を起こし、比叡山大衆が神輿を担いで強訴する騒ぎとなったため、師高は尾張国井戸田に流罪、師経は禁獄となった。
sen.e: In 1177, a conflict arose between Morotaka and Hakusan Yusen-ji Temple which was a branch temple of Enryaku-ji Temple, which turned out to be a commotion which was known as Goso (forceful complaint) by Hieizan Daishu (warrior monks residing in the zendo of Mt. Hiei) who marched en masse carrying the sacred mikoshi (portable shrine carried in festivals), resulting in Morotaka's banishment to Idota of Owari Province and Morotsune's imprisonment.

sen.j: 同時に天台座主明雲も解任され伊豆国へ配流となったが、大衆が配流途中の明雲を奪回し、叡山に帰還した。
sen.e: Concurrently, Tendai Zasu (head priest) Myoun was also dismissed and banished to Izu Province, but the general public rescued Myoun on his way to Izu, thus sending him back to Mt. Hiei.

sen.j: それに対し後白河は清盛に比叡山の攻撃を命じた。
sen.e: Emperor Goshirakawa, on learning about the rescued Myoun, ordered TAIRA no Kiyomori to attack Mt. Hiei.

sen.j: しかしその直後、多田行綱が鹿ケ谷の陰謀を平清盛に密告したため、比叡山攻撃のために集結していた平氏軍は攻撃を取りやめ、陰謀参加者の捕縛にあたった。
sen.e: Immediately after the imperial order was given, however, Yukitsuna TADA informed Kiyomori of the Shishigatani plot in secrecy, which caused Kiyomori to change his mind and redirected his army of the Taira clan which had been gathered for attacking Mt. Hiei to the capture of the plotters.

sen.j: 首謀者の一人であった父の西光は捕縛のうえ斬首され、師高も同年6月（1177年6月～7月）、小胡麻郡司維季（おぐまのぐんじ これすえ）に討たれ、師経・師平ほか郎党三名もも六条河原で斬首された。
sen.e: Morotaka's father Saiko was involved in the plot as a main culprit and was thereby arrested and beheaded, and Morotaka himself was also killed by OGUMANOGUNJI (which also read KOGUMANOGUNJI and KUGUMANOGUNJI) Koresue in June or July, 1177, which was followed by the execution of Morotsune, Morohira and their three retainers ('roto' in Japanese) by decapitation at the Rokujo-gawara riverbed.
